name: Imm Thai NYC
address: 80 Nassau St, New York, NY 10038, USA

reviews.text: Very good!
Great!
We had a great meal here. The food was great and the service even better.
One of my favourite neighbourhood Thai spots in Fidi! Super friendly staff and everything I‚Äôve had on the menu is yummy and filling. Definitely recommend the pad see ew and chicken cashew nut!
Very delicious food. Good lunch deal! I got the pad Thai and Thai iced tea for a good price. The pumpkin custard was also really good. Enjoyed the experience

This is my second time dining here and I totally love this restaurant! The quality of the food is amazing, full of flavor, and very good portion sizes too. I like the service too as everyone is always sweet and polite :)
10/10 would recommend!
Cozy atmosphere. Food was great!
Great!!!!
very good best hidden gem in nyc!!

So happy we stumbled on this jewel!!  The service was amazing and the food was incredible!!

Definitely recommend!!

I ordered the Drunken Noodles, and I honestly can‚Äôt believe this is supposed to be enough for one person. The portion was tiny! I went during lunch time and ordered the lunch special, but they told me because it‚Äôs a ‚Äúlunch deal,‚Äù they give a smaller portion. That‚Äôs ridiculous ‚Äî what‚Äôs the point of a ‚Äúdeal‚Äù if you‚Äôre just getting less food? Don‚Äôt be fooled by their so-called discounts. This is honestly a scam.
My favorite Thai spot in the area! My go to is the papaya salad and fresh spring rolls. Have tried and can recommend the fried crab salad, pad see ew, and the white fish.
So happy an actually good Thai place opened near me!!!!! My go to in fidi.
tast-eeeee
I'm so happy I found this cute little spot ! Vibes are impeccable - chill space with r&b tracks and great food!
The food is so nice and appetizing, close to the subway station, has a good ambient and also the staff really kind and helpful
This place is amazing. Wonderful vibes and delicious food
This place rocks!
Very fantastic and great service!!!
It was okay. I've had better.
Wonderful little spot with great fresh food.  Loved the Thai rice.
The glass noodle pad Thai was delicious and Michael the waiter was very sweet!
The Local Coconut Curry Salmon with white rice was not worth $20. It tasted good but there should be a vegetable(s) to balance the meal. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Excellent food and great atmosphere with friendly people. Hidden gem on Nassau Street!
Excellent food and service! Highly recommended!

I couldn't wait for this establishment to open and when it did I was so damn disappointed.
There about twenty Asian themed  restaurant in the area and only a handful of them that is actually worth the priceline.

Imagine going to this establishment and you open your bag to this.

I paid nearly $16.00 for it was  cold.

The chicken was hard as though it was sitting out in the open for a large amount of time.

The decor was the only thing deemed beauty in this place.

The lady with the blonde hair and dark roots was very nice also

I hope you last longer than the Indian restaurant that was previously there.
Food is so good definitely try the shrimp dumplings
Food is amazing 10/10
Super friendly staff and wonderful food!
Pad See Ew was truly great. Love other spotslike Soothr and Sappe but this is right up there with them!
Delicious, timely, clean, polite :) I enjoyed my meal very much!

Food was really good and tasted clean, not greasy at all. Food was prepared quickly and drinks were good too. Didn't have to wait for a seat and the vibes were very cozy. Prices are reasonable for good portions.
Great food and atmosphere!!

A Hidden Gem Worth Discovering!

The moment we walked by, the incredible aroma from Imm Thai pulled us right in  and we‚Äôre so glad it did! The food not only smells amazing but tastes even better. Every dish was full of flavor and perfectly balanced. The ambience is cozy and authentic, making it the perfect place to relax and enjoy a great meal.

The service was excellent, friendly, attentive, and made us feel truly welcome. You can tell the team here takes pride in what they do.

We‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon. Highly recommend this spot to anyone craving real, flavorful Thai food! üå∂Ô∏èüçúüáπüá≠
Delicious food, excellent service!
great food!
Everything was so delicious.

My review is just one of many singing this place's praises. Their food offers surprising yet satisfying options. The team creates genuine connections with guests. Straightforward food prepared skillfully satisfies me. Amazing dishes and incredibly welcoming assistance.

My favorite Thai restaurant in the city. It‚Äôs the one place I consistently come back to at least 2-3 times a month. I always order the glass noodle pad thai and papaya salad. Fast service, great food, made with love!
Cute small place serving good food with lunch specials and regular menu. I‚Äôll be back!
delicous pad kee maw and seafood tom yum soup with an amazing spice profile. would definitely recommend this spot!
Comforting food. Great atmosphere. Quick reliable service
Friendly, nice atmosphere
Had great drunken noodles at this place. Very accommodating of my vegetarian dietary restrictions. And Kat was such a nice server
kat was so nice!
Service was very good and Kat was super attentive and took care of us. Highly Recommend!
Not bad at all.
I ate Pad Kra Pao, the taste was so authentic like I had in Thailand. The restaurant staff Kat is very helpful and provides me a great services.
Great delicious Thai food
Lovely Thai location in Financial District

Ï∂îÏõåÏÑú Îì§Ïñ¥ÏôîÎäîÎç∞ ÎßõÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî Ï∂îÏ≤ú!

‚ú® Thai comfort at its finest ‚ú®
Dinner at IMM Thai Comfort Food was such a treat. The honey ginger ribs stole the show. The wings were crispy, saucy, and packed with flavor (the crunchy garlic + scallions were everything ü•πüî•). The crab rangoon were some of the best I‚Äôve had, cheesy, creamy, and loaded with real crab. ü¶Äüíõ

The curry crab? Immaculate. We absolutely demolished it. The Khao Man Gai (tender poached chicken with rice) was a comforting classic ‚Ä¶simple yet soulful, especially when eaten fresh. üçóüçö The Pad Thai leaned sweeter and nutty with the peanuts, not totally my vibe, but definitely still fresh and authentic.

Pairing it all with a crisp Thai beer just sealed the night. üç∫üå∂Ô∏è Truly a cozy spot for when you‚Äôre craving bold flavors and comfort all on one table.

Coming into this restaurant is like entering a calm zen-like place, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Located centrally, yet cut off from the noise.
The food is very good and feels authentic. The portions are decent - neither too large nor too small, enough to suffice one person.
The restroom is very well maintained and neat.
Overall a great place to dine at.

Imm Thai is fantastic! The food was fresh, flavorful, and authentic. We especially enjoyed their curries and stir-fry dishes. Service was friendly and attentive, making for a great dining experience. Highly recommend for anyone craving delicious Thai cuisine!

Lovely little hole in the wall spot! A lot of character in such a small place. We ordered the Pad Kee Mao and the fresh spring rolls. Both were excellent and we can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more things again!

Overall, it was a wonderful experience at a reasonable price. Highly recommended for anyone who loves authentic Thai food.
The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, and the staff were very attentive and friendly.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic comfort Thai food in the heart of downtown Manhattan, Imm Thai is the spot üíõüáπüá≠‚ú®

They bring the bold flavors of Sukhothai right to NYC ‚Äî from tom yum inspired dishes to classic hometown recipes with a creative twist.

We tried the Pad Thai glass noodles (so chewy, savory & satisfying üëå), the crab fried rice (a total must-try ü¶Äüçö), and the shrimp dumplings (perfect with their dipping sauce ü•üüî•).

Warm vibes, friendly service, and food that hits the soul ‚Äî Imm Thai is where you go when you want comfort food done right. üçú

Cute spot for Thai in FiDi with good music (pop/jazz/rnb) and no wait on a Saturday afternoon! I really enjoyed the taste and texture of the basil fried rice. The sticky rice that came with the Southern Thai Chicken was also really nice, with a light sweetness and great texture. The food also came out super quickly! Each dish is a good portion size for 1 person.

Absolutely loved this place! The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The Tom yum noodle soup and egg crab were standouts, and the staff was super warm and welcoming. Cozy atmosphere and great service ‚Äî will definitely be back!

Been back in NYC a week this trip, this might be the best find as yet!

Food is super flavourful, I feel like licking the plate of the chef‚Äôs special Pork Rib red curry.

Husband had a flat noodle thingy it was so delicious!

If you‚Äôre near Wall Street and craving authentic Thai street style food, this local gem delivers. The chicken wings and Thai combination makes the perfect appetizers, packed with flavor and just the right crunch. I also had the Thai coconut seafood soup, which came beautifully presented and full of traditional herbs like galangal and lemongrass(rare to find)so well done. If you like it spicy, I‚Äôd recommend the Tom Yum soup instead. They even serve Thai beer to complete the experience.

The portions are great and the food is delicious! I got the Thai chicken wings as an appetizer, pad crab curry and choo chee fish to share. The bathroom was clean and the restaurant had nice vibes. So glad we stumbled upon this place!

I discovered this small, cozy Thai restaurant near MTA Fulton St., and it‚Äôs a hidden gem! The old-style decor creates a warm and inviting atmosphere, making it a perfect spot for an authentic Thai meal.
The Pad Thai was made in true Thai street food style‚Äîflavorful, perfectly balanced, and not overly sweet like many other places. The Rib Red Curry was absolutely amazing! The ribs were tender, and the red curry sauce was rich, aromatic, and packed with bold flavors. Another must-try is the Fresh Roll with Tofu, which was light, refreshing, and paired beautifully with the dipping sauce.
If you‚Äôre looking for a spot with real Thai flavors in a cozy setting, this is definitely worth checking out. Highly recommend!

I came here with zero expectations, but this place deserves more attention! The food that I ordered was perfect. It was creamy, savory, sweet, and had everything nice in it. Not to mention, the place has a warm ambiance. I will come back!

I ordered the VEGETABLE SPRING ROLLS and my friend ordered the GARLIC OYSTER SAUCE with seafood. My sauce was very tasty, but there was not much of it and it was only enough for two of the four rolls. My friend liked her sauce and the squid was tender, although the rice was not the freshest. The service could have been friendlier. I received a free drink for this review.

Absolute Empfehlung!!!
Absolutes Geschmackserlebnis!
Zun√§chst wirkte das Restaurant von au√üen sehr unscheinbar. Uns √ºberzeugte die Karte und wir wurden nicht entt√§uscht, im Gegenteil. Das Essen ist GROSSARTIG!
Der K√ºchenchef zaubert authentische traditionelle Gerichte mit unvergleichbarem Geschmack und einer selten erlebten Harmonie von sauer, s√º√ü, salzig und (milder) Sch√§rfe und das zu absolut fairen Preisen.
Die Servicekraft war unglaublich aufmerksam, freundlich, unaufdringlich und doch immer da, sobald es einen Wunsch gab. Das Restaurant ist recht klein und hat kaum mehr als 30 Sitzpl√§tze aber gar eine sehr angenehme Atmosph√§re. Wir werden wieder kommen und k√∂nnen einen Besuch nur empfehlen.

I enjoyed my first Thai Pumpkin custard.  Am told this was new on the menu and glad I had room for dessert.  I would definitely have this again.  Apparently it goes by the name Sangkayaa in Thailand for those fortunate to have enjoyed this treat growing up in Thailand.

Small cosy place. Welcomed by the lady staff and quickly seated.
Ordered lunch special minced chicken pra kra pow and added fried egg with a minimal charge.
Portion was generous and sufficient.
When I enquired about drink, she recommended the blue pea tea which was refreshing and not too sweet.
Overall had an enjoyable lunch.
Came in after a long day of walking, everything in here was super clean, workers were very nice, portions were large and taste amazing, bathroom was spotless and would recommend eating here again!
Great food, nice vibe. Amazing service and very good prices for the quality. Did I say the music was great too.

They have amazing service with really kind workers, there are so many different foods to choose from, the atmosphere is nice, people are so nice !!
If you are looking for great thai food this is a must come!!
Only "bad" thing is the fact that the water running from the sinks in the bathroom are burning hot, but other than that its a really great restaurant  !!  ‚≠ê

I ordered take out crab curry a few weeks ago and was instantly hooked. To say I want to try everything on the menu is an understatement. The lunch special is so generous and delicious, they don‚Äôt skimp just because it‚Äôs a little cheaper. The servers are attentive and lovely.

We stumbled upon this place by chance, but the food was absolutely amazing!
We ordered three dishes and every single one was delicious.
The papaya salad especially stood out‚Äîit was tangy and so flavorful!
cozy interior nice mirror and the food is ok papaya salad and southern thai chicken was good but my shrimp was mid. Flavorful but soggy noodles.

First time trying this place and to be fair, I‚Äôm quite picky with pad thai - the flavor was not bad, however the noodles were very sticky and clumping together. My friend got the pad see ew, it looked a lot better and had ample amount of veggies. The portion of chicken on both were a bit small imo. I‚Äôm interested in trying their curry and soup noodles next time!
Amazing Thai food! The Tom Yum and Pad Kee Mao were so flavorful and fresh. Friendly service and cozy vibe. Definitely coming back!
Authentic Thai food in the heart of NYC downtown at reasonable price.  Like their red curry and Thai beer.  Great lunch set deals.
This is a great Thai place! The food tasted superb and was the right portion size. The inside is small, but so worth it if you have to wait. Lego Man can't wait to come back again.

I‚Äôve dined at the restaurant 4 times when I stayed in New York and it was an absolute delight! The food was incredibly yummy‚Äîevery dish burst with authentic Thai flavors. I especially loved the Pad Thai or Kra Pao, which was perfectly spiced and cooked to perfection. The ingredients tasted fresh, and the presentation was spot-on. What made the experience even better was the fantastic service. The staff were friendly, attentive, and quick to ensure we had everything we needed. The atmosphere was welcoming, and I left feeling satisfied and eager to return. Highly recommend this spot to anyone craving delicious Thai cuisine with a side of excellent hospitality!
We loved the food and the curry was sooo good! The servers were very kind as well and the prices were good.
The food was delicious and aesthetically pleasing!  This is exactly the restaurant we need after a busy and noisy day touring the NYC.
Came here with some friends and we all loved the food. The food was delicious,  we will definitely come back again. Amazing cozy vibes.
I have never had worse red curry. i actually dont even know if you could call it curry. not worth the 30 min lunch wait

Amazing! Lovely authentic restaurant! Thank you!
Friendly stuff and delicious food. Knowledge about vegan food. I preferred the vegetables noodle soup woth dumplings and the fried tofu was amazing.
Very tasty food, Fast service, kind waitress, good ambiance, seated immediately and good prices. I would highly recommend ! I came here on my break for lunch. I would definitely visit again.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Amazing Thai Food!

Delicious food, cozy vibes, and friendly service. The Panang curry was rich and flavorful, and the Thai iced tea hit the spot. You can really taste the quality and care in every bite. Highly recommend!

Great experience here after the long New York walks. Food was flavorful, well seasoned and comforting. Nice little spot
Definitely worth checking out
Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely little spot. The chicken masamam was exceptional, and the serving size is generous.
Super cute Thai place in the heart of the Financial District with lots of vegetarian options!
